item.title: 资产管理公司推出新的 ETF，利用人工智能的热潮
item.description: 随着资产管理公司为投资者提供利用市场对人工智能热情的新方法，专注于人工智能的交易所交易基金正在激增，尽管目前仍不清楚哪些公司将成为最新技术革命的长期赢家。【原文：Exchange-traded funds focused on artificial intelligence are proliferating as asset managers offer investors new ways to tap in to the market enthusiasm for AI, even while it remains unclear which companies will emerge as the long-term winners from the latest technology revolution.】

item.title: 中国经济复苏渺茫，部分企业改变策略
item.description: 随着房地产危机的持续和青年失业率的上升，中国客户正在削减开支。【原文：Chinese customers are cutting spending as the property crisis continues and youth unemployment rises.】

item.title: 欧洲航空公司第三季度因飞机延误和高成本而陷入困境
item.description: 包括汉莎航空（Lufthansa）和法荷航空（Air France-KLM）在内的欧洲主要航空公司预计将公布新一季的业绩报告，受成本上升和飞机数量有限的拖累，飞机制造商波音（Boeing）和空中客车（Airbus）推迟交货的情况也没有很快好转的迹象。【原文：Europe's major airlines including Lufthansa and Air France-KLM are expected to report another quarter dragged down by rising costs and limited planes, with no sign of delivery delays from planemakers Boeing and Airbus improving any time soon.】

item.title: 加息在即，日本央行努力加强沟通
item.description: 日本央行行长上田一夫在华盛顿出席国际货币基金组织和世界银行会议期间释放出的政策信号喜忧参半，除此之外，他还透露了日本央行正在就如何更好地与市场沟通进行反思。【原文：Aside from the mixed policy signals dropped during his trip to the International Monetary Fund and World Bank meetings in Washington, Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda offered a glimpse of how the central bank was doing some soul searching on ways to better communicate with markets.】

item.title: 消息人士称，波音公司计划最早于下周一启动超过 150 亿美元的融资计划
item.description: 一位知情人士告诉路透社，波音公司最早将于下周一启动融资超过 150 亿美元的计划。【原文：Boeing is set to launch as early as Monday its plan to raise more than $15 billion in capital, a source briefed on the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: 中国民办教师培训公司在打压后走出阴影
item.description: 目前还没有正式承认政策发生了变化。但现在政策制定者已经默许家教行业的发展，这是中国政府支持创造就业机会的一个举措。【原文：There has been no formal acknowledgement of a change in policy. But there is now tacit consent from policymakers to allow the tutoring industry to grow, in a pivot by Beijing to support job creation.】

item.title: 礼来获准在香港推出减肥药 - 彭博新闻社
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周日报道，礼来公司预计最早将于今年年底开始在香港销售其减肥药物。【原文：Eli Lilly expects to start selling its weight-loss drug in Hong Kong as early as the end of this year, Bloomberg News reported on Sunday.】

item.title: 奥林巴斯称首席执行官在被指控非法购药后下台
item.description: 日本医疗设备制造商奥林巴斯公司（Olympus Corp）周一表示，公司首席执行官斯蒂芬-考夫曼（Stefan Kaufmann）在被指控购买非法药物后已经下台。【原文：Japanese medical equipment maker Olympus Corp said on Monday that Chief Executive Stefan Kaufmann has stepped down after allegations he purchased illegal drugs.】

item.title: 中东局势暂缓，石油价格下滑；日本政府失去多数席位，日元下跌
item.description: 由于日本执政党失去议会多数席位，日元周一创下三个月新低，而以色列周末对伊朗的打击绕过了石油或核目标，导致石油价格暴跌。【原文：The yen hit a three-month low on Monday as Japan's ruling party lost its parliamentary majority, while oil tumbled after Israel's weekend strike on Iran bypassed oil or nuclear targets.】

item.title: 中国央行启动公开市场直接逆回购操作工具
item.description: 中国央行周一宣布启动公开市场直接逆回购操作工具，并将利用该工具每月与一级交易商进行公开市场操作交易。【原文：China's central bank announced on Monday it had activated its open market outright reverse repo operations facility and would use it to trade with primary dealers in open market operations on a monthly basis.】

item.title: LG 能源解决方案第三季度利润下滑，但超出市场预期
item.description: 韩国电池公司 LG Energy Solution（LGES）周一公布的季度利润下降了 39%，但由于一些欧洲和北美汽车制造商的需求有所改善，该公司的业绩比分析师担心的要好。【原文：South Korean battery firm LG Energy Solution (LGES) posted on Monday a 39% drop in quarterly profit, but the result was better than analysts had feared thanks to improved demand from some European and North American automakers.】

item.title: 劳埃德称，英国雇主进一步表现出预算前的紧张情绪
item.description: 周一的一项调查显示，在英国新政府出台首份预算计划之前，英国企业的信心在10月份降至四个月来的最低点，这与企业对可能增税感到紧张的其他迹象相呼应。【原文：British business confidence sank to a four-month low in October ahead of the first budget plan from the country's new government, a survey showed on Monday, echoing other signs of corporate nervousness about possible tax increases.】

item.title: 报告称，七个欧洲国家的创业友好型法律与美国不相上下
item.description: 风险投资公司 Index Ventures 的一份报告显示，七个欧洲国家已经修改了法律，以增加初创企业的员工所有权，从而在吸引人才和投资方面与美国相媲美，而其他国家则落在后面。【原文：Seven European countries have changed their laws to increase employee ownership in startups to rival the U.S. in attracting talent and investment, while other countries are lagging, a report by venture capital firm Index Ventures found.】

item.title: 用于航运的零碳氨面临成本和安全挑战
item.description: 首艘以氨水为动力的货轮将于 2026 年投入使用，这也是该行业为减少碳足迹而采用的几种替代方案之一。【原文：The first cargo ships that would be powered by ammonia are set to enter service in 2026, one of several alternatives the industry is tapping to shrink its carbon footprint.】

item.title: 日本大选结果给日本央行加息前景蒙上阴影，日元下跌
item.description: 日元周一触及三个月低点，原因是日本执政联盟失去了议会多数席位，投资者认为这可能会减缓未来的加息步伐，而美元则因美国收益率上升而实现月度上涨。【原文：The yen touched a three-month low on Monday as Japan's ruling coalition lost its parliamentary majority and investors figured that would likely slow future interest rate hikes, while the dollar headed for a monthly gain on rising U.S. yields.】

item.title: 麦当劳排除牛肉饼是大肠杆菌爆发源头的可能性
item.description: 在新鲜洋葱被指可能是疫情爆发源头后，美国连锁快餐店已从其菜单上撤下了新鲜洋葱。【原文：U.S. fast-food chains have pulled fresh onions out of their menu items after they were named as the likely source of the outbreak.】

item.title: 以色列对伊朗的打击表现出克制，石油每桶下跌近 4 美元
item.description: 以色列上周末对伊朗的报复性打击绕过了德黑兰的石油和核基础设施，没有中断能源供应，从而缓解了中东地区的地缘政治紧张局势。【原文：Oil prices tumbled nearly $4 a barrel on Monday after Israel's retaliatory strike on Iran over the weekend bypassed Tehran's oil and nuclear infrastructure and did not disrupt energy supplies, easing geopolitical tensions in the Middle East.】

item.title: 早间新闻日本大选冲击波拉开关键一周的序幕
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 澳新银行集团因收购新科集团而蒙受约 1.3 亿美元的利润损失
item.description: 澳大利亚贷款机构澳新银行集团（ANZ Group）周一表示，由于收购Suncorp银行业务的影响，其2024年下半年的税后利润将受到1.96亿澳元（1.2963亿美元）的冲击。【原文：Australian lender ANZ Group said on Monday its 2024 second half profit will take a A$196 million ($129.63 million) hit after taxes due to impacts from the acquisition of Suncorp's banking business.】

item.title: 大众汽车考虑削减工资和奖金以节省 40 亿欧元 - Handelsblatt
item.description: 据《Handelsblatt》周日援引公司内部人士的话报道，大众汽车正在为其核心品牌探索一系列削减成本的措施，包括减薪 10%和冻结工资两年，以寻求节省 40 亿欧元。【原文：Volkswagen is exploring a series of cost-cutting measures for its core brand, including a 10% wage cut and a two-year wage freeze, as it seeks to save 4 billion euros, Handelsblatt newspaper reported on Sunday, citing company insiders.】

item.title: 日本日经指数和日元将因政治不确定性而下滑
item.description: 出口民调显示，日本首相石破茂领导的联盟将在周日的选举中失去议会多数席位，预计日本股市和日元将下跌，而较长期的国内政府债券收益率将上升。【原文：Japanese stocks and the yen are expected to fall while longer-dated domestic government bond yields are seen rising as exit polls suggest Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba's coalition is set to lose its parliamentary majority in Sunday's election.】

item.title: 消息人士称，Swiggy 再次将 IPO 估值下调至 113 亿美元，贝莱德和 CPPIB 将参与投资
item.description: 消息人士称，市场波动和现代印度公司首次亮相的低迷影响了市场情绪。【原文：Market volatility and the lacklustre debut of Hyundai India weigh on sentiment, sources said.】

item.title: 以色列克制打击伊朗，油价可能下跌
item.description: 分析师说，由于以色列上周末对伊朗的报复性打击绕过了德黑兰的石油和核基础设施，没有破坏能源供应，预计周一恢复交易后油价将下跌。【原文：Oil prices are expected to fall when trading resumes on Monday as Israel's retaliatory strike on Iran over the weekend bypassed Tehran's oil and nuclear infrastructure and did not disrupt energy supplies, analysts said.】

item.title: 据 The Information 报道，谷歌将开发可接管计算机的人工智能
item.description: 据 The Information 周六报道，Alphabet 旗下的谷歌公司正在开发人工智能技术，该技术可以接管网络浏览器，完成研究和购物等任务。【原文：Alphabet's Google is developing artificial intelligence technology that takes over a web browser to complete tasks such as research and shopping, The Information reported on Saturday.】

item.title: 贝利表示，英格兰银行将继续推行数字货币，以防银行资金短缺
item.description: 英格兰银行行长安德鲁-贝利（Andrew Bailey）周六表示，由于商业银行有可能无法跟上监管较少的科技公司的步伐，英格兰银行正在勉为其难地加紧工作，以创建一种大众可以使用的数字货币。【原文：The Bank of England is reluctantly pressing on with work to create a form of digital money accessible to the general public, as commercial banks risk failing to keep up with less-regulated tech firms, Governor Andrew Bailey said on Saturday.】

item.title: 利比亚国家石油公司称，意大利埃尼公司和英国石油公司在中断 10 年后恢复了在利比亚的陆上钻探活动
item.description: 利比亚国家石油公司（NOC）周六表示，意大利能源公司埃尼公司（Eni）和英国石油巨头英国石油公司（BP）已恢复在利比亚的勘探工作，此前两国曾于2014年停止陆上钻探。【原文：Italian energy company Eni and British oil giant BP have resumed exploration in Libya after onshore drilling was halted in 2014, Libya's national oil corporation (NOC) said on Saturday.】

item.title: 中国领导的亚洲国际投资银行行长批评发达国家设置贸易壁垒
item.description: 亚洲基础设施投资银行（亚投行）行长金立群周六批评发达经济体设置贸易壁垒，包括对可再生能源产品设置贸易壁垒，称全球经济中 "不再有自由贸易"。【原文：Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank (AIIB) President Jin Liqun on Saturday criticized advanced economies for creating trade barriers including for renewable energy goods, saying there was "no longer free trade" in the global economy.】

item.title: 消息人士称，在华为处理器上发现芯片后，台积电暂停向中国公司发货
item.description: 为保护美国国家安全，华为被限制购买该技术。【原文：Huawei is restricted from buying the technology to protect U.S. national security.】

item.title: 消息人士称，意大利警方因涉嫌非法访问数据库逮捕四人
item.description: 一位直接了解此事的人士告诉路透社，意大利警方已经软禁了四人，作为对一名前警察经营的私人情报机构涉嫌非法访问国家数据库的调查的一部分。【原文：Italian police have placed four people under house arrest as part of a probe into alleged illegal access to state databases by a private intelligence business run by a former policeman, a person with direct knowledge of the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: 中国在美方会议上对关税和制裁表示关切
item.description: 中国财政部周六表示，在华盛顿举行的两国经济工作组会议上，中国表达了对美国关税和俄罗斯相关制裁的关切。【原文：China expressed concern over U.S. tariffs and Russia-related sanctions during a meeting of the two countries' Economic Working Group in Washington, China's finance ministry said on Saturday.】
